page.title: 04RELIGION IN CORBRIDGE
page.content: The Parish Church of St.Andrew, founded by St.Wilfrid in the 8th. century shows evidence of all periods from earliest Saxon building,still entire.In 1985 the entire roof is being renewed at a cost of 50,000 pounds,the present generation being very aware of their heritage and responsibility to the future Christian community.The electoral roll numbers 456.The vicar has assistance from three retired clergy and the neighbouring small parish of Halton is also in his care.The Roman Catholic community,lacking their own church building,use St.Aandrews on Saturday evenings and some festival days.The Methodist Church,with 120 members, meets in Princes Street Chapel.Study and Fellowship groups cater for children and adults in all Churches.
